comments.commentBody:
There is no joke here.
We have people in power who are treasonous
lying crooks at all levels.
It's no longer a question of democrats and republicans.
We are all Americans and our democracy is in serious trouble.
This is not the democrats fault,
If this were Mrs. Clinton, she would have already been impeached. I guess republicans get Carte Blanche to commit treason.

And we all know how subtle Trump, Pence et al are.
Besides, the Republicans are sticking their chins out begging "hit me". The Democrats are not undermining the Trump administration, Trump and his gang of fools are doing it to themselves.

I would opt for a long, meandering investigation, and keeping Sessions in office. Instead of removal from office, why not censure? He will be weakened by the scandal, and served notice that we are watching him closely. Maybe he will be less enthusiastic about abridging citizens' rights, killing off the legalized pot industry and other right-wing agendas, if  he is only an inquiry away from losing his dream job...

The reason that his lies work is because he has been privileged to live in his little white, male world where facts are inconsequential, and the "First Church of the Good Ol' Boy" reigns supreme.   They are shocked that it's not working.

There are clearly different standards for Republicans versus Democrats.  This Russia business is sordid to say the least.  We still don't have answers, but it practically smacks of treason.  Never mind that this administration really does seem intent on "blowing the whole thing up".  Is that by design or due to incompetence?  Yet, here were are, helpless to do anything about the corruption, cronyism, and lies.
It makes it more imperative than ever to subpoena that man in the White House's tax returns. Maybe there's nothing there, no smoking gun. Maybe.

If any close to this had occurred under Obama or HRC, the Republicans would be howling.  Fox would be on it every second of every day.  There would be one investigation after the other.  Impeachment proceedings would already be underway.

He was asked a direct question and volunteered a response that has proven to a lie and somehow it is not perjury.  What is with the federal government and not prosecuting people like Flynn and Sessions because its just to hard and unprecented  No wonder these folks do stupid stuff , because they can get away with it.

How about another suggestion? I don't like being disrespectful of one of our US senators. But Jeff Sessions is being disingenuous and disrespectful of our Constitution, Congress and his current office of AG. So, I guess I have the right as a tax paying citizen to have an opinion about his next adventure.
He is such a sweet, smiley little guy, that I think he would make a great actor for the next Disney fairy tale movie that includes a part for a smiling older gentleman who also, unfortunately doesn't have clue as to what he has been appointed to, but does have lots of opinions about what should happen to minority voters or refugees and those Russians some of us worry about. Smile, and smile, and be a villain too.

"Democrats...apparently not caring a fig about the greater damage it does to our governance."

If I'm recalling correctly, and feel free to correct me if I'm wrong Richard, you blame former President Obama for all of our non-governance issues over the past 6-8 years. You claimed he was not capable and did not have the ability or talent to work with the republicans during his terms in office. He was the problem and so we had to elect trump, a republican, because electing Hillary Clinton would continue the problem. Let's reward the republicans for their bad behavior.

Please tell me why the democrats have to be the ones to lose, to stand down, to acquiesce, in order for this republic of ours to have proper governance? Why not blame the republicans for their obstruction, for their theft of a SCOTUS appointment, for their lies, for their lies under oath, for their inexperience and bumbling, for their secretiveness regarding contacts with the Russians, for the disgusting things they say about women, for their racism? How many times must they place their record before us and how long must we analyze their actions before we say enough!

Why do they continue to get a pass from you to continue their destructive and potentially nefarious ways with this country of OURS instead of you "caring a fig about the greater damage it does to our governance?"

I'm a far-to-the-left liberal myself, but I have always tried to respect Republicans as people who have a different vision for the country, one they believe in as much as I believe in my own. I happen to think they are wrong, but I am also aware that they feel as strongly that I am wrong. At the end of the day, we all have the interests of our beautiful country at heart (or so I have always thought).

But now it is absolutely impossible for me not to despise anyone who identifies as a Republican--either as politician or as a voter. They are so hungry for power and for tax cuts for themselves and their rich friends that they are a) willing to allow this appalling, mentally ill, thoroughly corrupt and utterly stupid man Trump to be in power as our president and b) not willing to investigate Russia's involvement in our election (after years of nonsense about Benghazi (OMG!) and emails (OMG!!!!!!)--the good of the people and this country be damned. How thoroughly despicable, all of them. We used to be better than this.
It is not the lies per se nor even the Russian connection, it is the contempt they showed Congress.

I have an easy explanation for what went wrong with Jeff Sessions. He's that grown-up kid with whom no one would play. He had a hick hillbilly accent, he was the shortest kid in class, he didn't play sports, wasn't even all THAT smart, and had a face only a mouse mother could love. He couldn't even find a wife. His awful personality adds to that. His social skills and common sense are so lacking I question whether he lies somewhere on the Asperger's spectrum. This is a man I would not date or have as a friend. He's a total self-absorbed dork. His only success in life is being an attorney and I can't believe anyone elected him to an office. But here we are.

I don't know what we can do about him, but my experience with former dorks -- they have an axe to grind, and it always bites you in the back end.

That is the heartbreaking part.  It appears that the Republicans such as McConnell and Ryan would rather see this country brought to its knees than to take the steps to rid ourselves of the intruders and to call treason by its name when they are looking it square in the face.

My understanding is that in addition to "misspeaking" during his testimony, he also omitted his Russian meeting and conversation in a written response, a response that is crafted and vetted by aides with access to his records. This to me shows more clearly a willful attempt to deceive.

There could indeed be some sinister collusion between Trump camp and Russia. But I'm just as willing to bet that Trump camp got totally punked, I.e., manipulated through and through, buy Russian agents, and they have every reason to be just as nervous about the truth of either scenario.

No decent person could be charmed by a warmed over, southern-fried racist. I imagine his "charm" is borne only of the fact that there is no one decent left in Washington to be repelled by him. But that means there is no one decent left to replace him either.

The choices of the Trump years- Stick with garbage, or replace garbage with trash.

It seems like it should be getting a bit hard for even the strongest supporters of Trump to keep supporting him in this (unless there is a direct paycheck involved, of course).  There is a note of desperation as they keep trying to explain why a lie isn't really a lie and a coverup wasn't really a coverup.   I have noticed a certain number of them have grown very quiet lately.

Don't count on any real investigations from Congress. Republicans will waste tons of money on investigating Democrats and coming up empty, but not one red cent on investigating other Republicans even if there is danger to our democracy that needs repair. They are simply so partisan that they have lost any interest in our nation. All they care about is their own party remaining in power.

As for Sessions, he may have said he'd recuse himself. I doubt he'll keep hands off, but in DC these days, it doesn't matter what you do. It matters what you say, and he used the right word. Don't count on Congress policing him on this, either.

And Americans will continue to vote against their best interests and pretend they've done the right thing. We are that stupid.

Dear Amy,
I hope you are somewhere with your family reading these comments and feeling all the love that is coming your way. It is little enough gift back to you. Some of us have loved you for years. Your whimsy, your humor, your joy was reflected in every page your wrote and sharing those books with families and children was my job and my delight for so many years as a children's librarian and now an independent bookstore owner where some of your books happen to be featured and face out on the shelves in my tiny store as I type even before I read your sad news. I also loved your adult books. All of us in the library and book world will miss you, will remember you and will keep sharing your spirit. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for being you.

Wish I could know you better. For while your Jason is undoubtedly amazing, I suspect you are as well...
Go gently...

This column was so sweet, calm and warmly painful. How wonderful that love, happiness and friendship bonded your lives together and blossomed into children. I'm so sorry that your beautiful life will end soon and that Jason will be without your love.

As others here have pointed out, Amy, your husband is an amazing guy but you brought out his great qualities. I hope, like you, that another woman will do the same. I know he will never forget you.

I wholeheartedly agree. Before marriage all my good qualities came from my father and mother, and some from my grandfather too. After marriage, all additions and renovations to my persona were my wife's works. Nita left this planet last year, exactly 41 years to the day when we first met - a few months before our 40th wedding anniversary. I miss her all the time, every day of the week, every hour. My eyes, too, often well up with water and I make no attempt to curb or  control it. I consider those tears as symbols of my deep, deep love for her. Sorta my valentine greetings for her, tears filling in for words that fail me at the time I look for them. Love is the most wonderful of all human feelings and experience. Hold on to it with dear life, if you are lucky to experience it. (Btw, I'm also a lawyer, but have no heart or desire left to go back to my day job).
There will only ever be a "Jason & Amy" love story.  Be at peace.
This is one of the most beautiful things I've ever read.  Thank you.
